title: Introduction
description: Start learning JavaScript from basics: what it is, how it runs, and how to set up your environment.

lessons.title: What is JavaScript?
lessons.summary: Learn what JavaScript is and why it is essential for building interactive websites.
lessons.content: JavaScript is a high-level, dynamic programming language used to make websites interactive. It runs in the browser and on servers using environments like Node.js.

lessons.title: How JavaScript Works
lessons.summary: Understand how the JS engine, call stack, and event loop execute code.
lessons.content: JavaScript runs inside a browser's JS engine (such as V8). It uses a single-threaded event loop, call stack, and Web APIs to manage asynchronous tasks efficiently.

lessons.title: Setup Environment
lessons.summary: Set up Node.js, VS Code, and create your first JS file.
lessons.content: To start coding in JS, install Node.js, choose a code editor like VS Code, and set up a basic project folder with an index.js file.

title: Basics
description: Understand fundamental programming concepts like variables, data types, and operators.

lessons.title: Variables
lessons.summary: Learn about variable declaration using let, const, and var.
lessons.content: Variables store data values. JavaScript provides let, const, and var. Prefer const for values that do not change and let for reassignable values.

lessons.title: Data Types
lessons.content: JavaScript has primitive types (string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, bigint) and reference types (objects, arrays, functions).

lessons.title: Operators
lessons.summary: Learn arithmetic, comparison, logical, and assignment operators.
lessons.content: Operators include arithmetic (+, -, *, /), comparison (==, ===, !=), logical (&&, ||), and assignment (=, +=). They help perform operations on values.

lessons.title: Conditionals
lessons.summary: Control flow using if/else and switch.
lessons.content: Conditional statements control decisions using if, else if, else, and switch. They allow programs to perform different actions based on conditions.

title: Functions
description: Learn to write modular code using functions, scopes, and hoisting.

lessons.title: Function Basics
lessons.summary: Understand function declarations, arguments, and return values.
lessons.content: Functions are reusable blocks of code. Declare them using function declarations, expressions, or arrow functions. They help keep code modular.

lessons.title: Arrow Functions
lessons.summary: Shorter syntax + lexical binding of this.
lessons.content: Arrow functions provide shorter syntax and lexically bind 'this'. Example: const sum = (a, b) => a + b.

lessons.title: Scope & Hoisting
lessons.summary: Understand how variable visibility works in JS.
lessons.content: Scope defines the accessibility of variables. Hoisting moves declarations to the top of their scope, allowing usage before definition (with limitations).

title: DOM Manipulation
description: Learn how to interact with and update web pages using JavaScript.

lessons.title: Selecting Elements
lessons.summary: Learn DOM selectors like querySelector and getElementById.
lessons.content: You can select elements using querySelector, getElementById, and class selectors. Example: document.querySelector('.btn').

lessons.title: Updating Elements
lessons.summary: Update text, HTML, and styles in the DOM.
lessons.content: Change text, HTML, or styles using innerText, innerHTML, and style properties. Example: element.style.color = 'red'.

lessons.title: Event Listeners
lessons.summary: Handle events such as clicks, input, and hover.
lessons.content: Use addEventListener to respond to user actions. Example: button.addEventListener('click', handleClick).

title: Asynchronous JavaScript
description: Handle asynchronous operations using callbacks, promises, and async/await.

lessons.title: Callbacks
lessons.content: Callbacks are functions passed as arguments to other functions, mainly used for async operations. They can lead to callback hell.

lessons.title: Promises
lessons.summary: Learn how promises work with then() and catch().
lessons.content: Promises represent the result of an async operation. They have states: pending, fulfilled, rejected. Use .then() and .catch() to handle them.

lessons.title: Async/Await
lessons.summary: Write cleaner async code using async/await.
lessons.content: Async/await provides cleaner async code. Example: const data = await fetch(url).then(res => res.json()).
